section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Excise tax" means the tax imposed under § 13-809 of this subtitle.
A credit is allowed against the excise tax imposed for a qualified plug-in electric drive vehicle.
Subject to the limitations under subsections (c) through (e) of this section, the credit allowed under this section equals 100% of the excise tax imposed for a vehicle.

text.section: The credit allowed under this section may not exceed $2,000.

The credit allowed under this section is limited to the acquisition of:
One vehicle per individual; and
10 vehicles per business entity.

A credit may not be claimed under this section:
For a vehicle unless the vehicle is registered in the State;
Unless the manufacturer has already conformed to any applicable State or federal laws or regulations governing clean-fuel vehicle or electric vehicle purchases applicable during the calendar year in which the vehicle is titled; or
For a vehicle that was initially registered in another state.
The Motor Vehicle Administration shall administer the credit under this section.
